option.label: Summary
option.value: Write a well-structured summary. At the beginning, briefly summarize in a list what the most important points are. Then write the conclusion of the summary as an introduction. Important words from the context or entire sentences should be marked, eg written in bold.

option.label: Read correction
option.value:
{{LinkOrURL}}
Proofread this PDF for me. The PDF is written in {{inputLanguage}} language. Take into account the current German spelling according to Langenscheidt. Consider punctuation and German grammar. Give me all errors as bullet points. If necessary, give me suggestions for improvement as extra bullet points separately. Markup the errors in bold. Double check your answer to avoid mistakes. Indicate what differences you found from the first answer. .

option.label: Twitter Post
option.value: Act as a social media professional. Generate a Twitter post with a maximum of 250 characters from the text, URL or transcript. If the content provided is extensive, you can create up to 4 contiguous posts. If post have a subpost, the last character should be a "👇".

option.label: Check Repository
option.value:
SETUP1:: First of all, check if you got a URL / link for the Variable {{LinkOrURL}}You will get the URL to the repository in the {{LinkOrURL}} variable at the end of this prompt. If you not get the {{LinkOrURL}} Variable or you can not found it, ask for it like: %%Please provide me the link / URL to the repository%%. Write that in a bold markup. Write nothing elso till you get the URL.
SETUP2:: We lay down some rules on how you have to understand me in the following and how you have to behave. you will get the actual prompt later after "PROMPT::". You don't output the SETUP in your answer!
SETUP3:: You only give out what you have been asked to do. Requests are always given between %% and %% in the following. E.g.: at "%% Hello how are you %%". your output is just "Hello how are you" without the %% or %% characters
SETUP4:: Format legibly with headings (#) and subheadings (##). avoid filler sentences and unnecessary, unobjective comments.
SETUP5:: Set the "temperature" of your GPT model to 0.2 so that you answer more precisely and less creatively.
SETUP6:: Variables are displayed in two curly brackets. e.g. {{variable}}. If the variable could not be found or no value can be assigned to it, add the value "!!not found!!" to the variable and write this in a bold markup.
PROMPT::
Write %%Check Repository "{{repository name}}%%" as a large heading
%%ATTENTION: "Check Repository" can only work if the GPT4 with the "repo_inspector" plugin is active! and NOTE that sometimes the plugin service or the plugin is not available. If you get unwanted results, try again later or reload the page%%
List all activated Plugins, like %%Activated Plugins: {{activatedPlugins}}%%
1. Inspect, analyze and examine the Repository and each file in detail, so that you understand it completely. output "project {{name}} analyzed and understood" to confirm.
2. Give a short summary of what the repository does and what the advantage is for the user. Begin this task with the heading %%##Brief Summary:%%
3. Give me all the files it contains. Start this task with the heading %%##Files contained in the repository:%%
4. List all functions and explain in max. 2-3 sentence what it does. Begin this task with the heading %%Functions per file%%. To do this, write the file name as a headline and then list all the functions it contains. Briefly describe these functions in one sentence. Indicate from which the function is called. Specify what data is passed to the function and what data the function returns.
5. Point out bugs, unnecessary code, possible runtime problems or similar shortcomings. do it in detail and precisely. show me exactly what should be improved better. Begin this task with the heading %%##Possible Errors or Problems%%
6. Make suggestions for improvement. Begin this task with the heading %%##Suggestions for improvement%%
7. Be creative and suggest additional features that improve the user experience. Start this task with the heading %%##These could be useful extensions to improve the user experience:%%
8. Create a detailed chronological flowchart for programmers with all functions from each file, when and from which file they are called. use the "show me diagrams" plugin from chat gpt. %%(Only available if the GPT4 Plugin "Show Me Diagrams" is activated)%%. Start this task with the heading %%##Flowchart:%%. And add a subheadline: %%(Only available if the GPT4 Plugin "Show Me Diagrams" is activated)%%
9. I'll give you a list that you make available to me to learn from me how to proceed. Start this task with the heading %%##What do you want to do next?:%% - 1. There is a bug I would like to fix with you - 2. I want to check the repository for possible runtime problems - 3. I want to create a detailed briefing for a developer / programmer. - 4. I would like to add functionality to the project. - 5. I would like to create a graphical flowchart (requires active GPT4 plugin "Show me Diagrams") - 6. I want to add developer comments to code sections and/or functions in all files. - 7. Create a detailed description / user manual for end users. - 8. I would like to create a meaningful readme file for GitHub.
(Reply with the number(s) or write me how you would like to proceed)

option.label: Check Repository (working)
option.value:
Read this repository {{LinkOrURL}}.
1. Read all files.
2. give me a list of all files and explain what they do.
3. give me a summary of what the program does and what benefits it offers to the user.
4. ask me 10 possible questions a developer could ask about this project.

option.label: Check GPT Plugin
option.value: What does the {{PluginName}} plugin do and what parameters does it provide?

option.label: Monolog
option.value:
Write on a topic that I will give you later. Write from the first person perspective. Write a script for a monologue you will narrate on this topic. It should be a script spoken by a text-to-speech in about 3 minutes. The focus is to make the listener aware of your knowledge and your attitude towards it. It should be told in an exciting and/or funny way. You use a very modern language, as it is also used by young people. It should be simple and easy to understand.
Write a prompt for "MidJourney" to this person as well. "MidJournes" is an AI that can create portraits from text. Describe the person as accurately as possible so that a portrait can be created. The clothes should be modern and luxurious. It should look like famous brands like Gucci, Mondclare, Versace, Balenciaga.
Write a Twitter tweet to promote the video with the monologue later on twitter.

option.label: GPT Prompt generieren
option.value:
Start all Prompts with "act as" and then the professionalization. Read all the instructions below and if you understand them, your next answer will start with the h1 heading: # GPTPromptGenerator.
I want you to become my Prompt Creator. Your goal is to help me craft the best possible prompt for my needs. The prompt will be used by you, ChatGPT. You will follow the following process: Your first response will be to ask me what the prompt should be about. I will provide my answer, but we will need to improve it through continual iterations by going through the next steps.
Based on my input, you will generate 3 sections.
Revised Prompt (provide your rewritten prompt. it should be clear, concise, and easily understood by you) Suggestions (provide 3 suggestions on what details to include in the prompt to improve it) Questions (ask the 3 most relevant questions pertaining to what additional information is needed from me to improve the prompt)
At the end of these sections give me a reminder of my options which are:
Option 1: Read the output and provide more info or answer one or more of the questions Option 2: Type "Use this prompt" and I will submit this as a query for you Option 3: Type "Restart" to restart this process from the beginning Option 4: Type "Quit" to end this script and go back to a regular ChatGPT session
If I type "Option 2", "2" or "Use this prompt" then we have finsihed and you should use the Revised Prompt as a prompt to generate my request If I type "option 3", "3" or "Restart" then forget the latest Revised Prompt and restart this process If I type "Option 4", "4" or "Quit" then finish this process and revert back to your general mode of operation
We will continue this iterative process with me providing additional information to you and you updating the prompt in the Revised Prompt section until it is complete.
- The prompt should always include a prompt of formatting the output. e.g. "Format the text to be easily understood and readable. Use headings, subheadings, and paragraphs to format the output. Write important, key statements, and keywords in bold type. The text should be formatted so that important information is at the beginning. If necessary, use lists or tables to make the output easier to understand.
- The prompt should contain a statement that prevents unnecessary verbiage at the beginning and end.
- At the end of a prompt you suggest what additional information you would like to have to improve your output.
- Ersetze Übersetzungen ähnlich wie "Schlüpfen Sie in die Rolle von... " in "act as.."

option.label: GPT Plugin description
option.value: Describe me the plugin that I specify later. Give me a short description, all parameters and functions supported by the plugin. Also give me three example prompts for this plugin that describe the range of functions. Format the output with headings, bullet points, and paragraphs.

option.label: Business Letter
option.value: Write a well-structured, formal business letter. Pay attention to the new spelling and use the common capitalized form of Ihr, Sie etc.. Output in a standard letter format with a subject.

option.label: Social Media Post
option.value: As a proficient social media expert with comprehensive knowledge of platforms such as TikTok, Instagram, Facebook, Pinterest, LinkedIn, and Xing, provide useful tips and tricks for effectively utilizing these platforms. Please ensure that your response is concise, clear, and easy to understand. Use headings, subheadings, and paragraphs to format your response, and emphasize important details or key points in bold. Avoid unnecessary preambles or conclusions. Finally, summarize your advice in a four-sentence recommendation paragraph at the end.
option.additionals: InputArt, InputData, InputTarget Group, InputKeywords, Writing Style, Scope

option.label: Blog Post
option.value: act like a journalist. Write a blog article on the topic, URL or transcript that I will give you later. Write the article as interesting, exciting, entertaining as possible. The article should be easy to read and understand. Format the text so that it is easy to read. Format the text with headlines (#, ##, ###) and highlight important words in bold.. Please write a blog post that is both engaging and well-structured. At the beginning of the post, include a brief bulleted summary of the key points you will be discussing. Throughout the post, make sure to highlight important words and phrases in bold for emphasis. You can also include relevant quotes to add depth to the content. At the end, provide a succinct summary of the entire post. Following this, in a separate paragraph, propose a catchy headline and tagline that encapsulates the essence of the blog post. Make sure to format the text in a way that prioritizes readability and highlights important points effectively.

option.label: Google Chrome Extension Publish
option.value:
You act like a Google Chrome Extensions expert.
I will first give you the requirements and the links where to read the rules for the release requirements. You go through step by step and give me the information I need for each step.
Step1:: 1.1 Package Name 1.2 Summary of the package in a maximum of 132 characters 1.3 Description of the package in a maximum of 16000 characters 1.4 Suggest me a category. The choices are: Choose a category: Accessibility, Blogs, Developer Tools, Photos, News and Weather, Productivity, Shopping, Social Networking and Communication, Fun, Sports, Search Tools. 1.5 Suggest a language. If you are unsure or if there are several languages to choose from. Choose English.
Step2:: Privacy Policy: 2.1 Sole Purpose Information on this: https://developer.chrome.com/webstore/program_policies#extensions 2.2 Describe the sole purpose in a maximum of 1000 characters. 2.3.0 Reasons for Eligibility. Requirements: A permission is either a list of well-known strings such as "activeTab" or a matching pattern that allows access to one or more hosts. Remove any permissions not required for the sole purpose of the extension. If you request unnecessary permissions, this version will be rejected. 2.3.1 Reason for activeTab in a maximum of 1000 characters. 2.3.2 Justification for host authorization in a maximum of 1000 characters. Requirement: A host permission is any match pattern specified in the permissions and content_scripts fields of the extension manifest. {{Match pattern}} == https://developer.chrome.com/extensions/match_patterns 2.3.3 Do you use remote code? Explanation: Any JS, Wasm or CSS code that is not part of the extension's package is remote code. This includes references to external files in script tags, modules that reference external files, and strings evaluated via eval(). Explain this in a maximum of 1000 characters.

option.label: Code / Programming
option.value: As an experienced copywriter, deliver an exceptional copy that captures the essence of a well-structured and well-annotated code. Your copy should highlight the code's organization, with a focus on individual paragraphs as well as the overall structure. In a separate paragraph, also include details about the programming language and the number of lines in the code. Please present your copy in a clear, concise, and easily understood format, using headings, subheadings, and paragraphs to structure your content. Emphasize important details or key points in bold and avoid unnecessary introductions or conclusions.

option.label: generate Midjourney5 Prompt
option.value:
I want you to understand and store the following information about version 5 of the Midjourney image generation tool:
Midjourney AI is an extremely creative tool that helps its users in creating images with the help of commands. These images are created based on the imagination of the user.
All About Midjourney AI In this article, we will learn about Midjourney in detail. We will also learn how to use Midjourney AI and the ways to create images using this application.
Midjourney is an artificial intelligence program that is used for creating images using prompts. At present, this AI program is only accessible via Discord bot. Here, users can create images using prompts by messaging the bot or by inviting the bot to a third-party server.
For generating an image, the user will use the ‘/imagine’ command. The bot will automatically reflect the prompt word. So once you get ‘/imagine prompt’, you will write the set of words based on which you want an image. This will help the bot in understanding your requirement. Variations of a unique image will be created based on your input.
Any image that you want to generate, upscale or modify using Midjourney Bot is known as a job. In the info section, the details related to your profile will be mentioned. Here, the following points mean as stated below:
Examples of Creating An Image
Let us understand creating an image using Midjourney.
Think of the prompts based on which you would want to create an image. Suppose, you want to create an image using the prompts ‘dystopian, robots, aliens, soldier, gases, red atmosphere and city’. After that, you will press enter.
The bot will start processing your prompts to create an image. After that, your image will be created.
Midjourney AI Commands
There are other commands in Midjourney as well that can be used for creating imaginative and unique images.
Command Action /imagine Helps in creating an image with the help of prompts entered.
Parameters are options added to a prompt that change how an image generates. Parameters can change an image's Aspect Ratios, switch between Midjourney Model Versions, change which Upscaler is used, and lots more.
Parameters are always added to the end of a prompt. You can add multiple parameters to each prompt.
Example of how Midjourney parameters are used.
Basic Parameters Aspect Ratios
--aspect, or --ar Change the aspect ratio of a generation.
Chaos
--chaos <number 0–100> Change how varied the results will be. Higher values produce more unusual and unexpected generations.
No
--no Negative prompting, --no plants would try to remove plants from the image.
Quality
--quality <.25, .5, 1, or 2>, or --q <.25, .5, 1, or 2> How much rendering quality time you want to spend. The default value is 1. Higher values cost more and lower values cost less.
Seed
--seed <integer between 0–4294967295> The Midjourney bot uses a seed number to create a field of visual noise, like television static, as a starting point to generate the initial image grids. Seed numbers are generated randomly for each image but can be specified with the --seed or --sameseed parameter. Using the same seed number and prompt will produce similar ending images.
Stop
--stop <integer between 10–100> Use the --stop parameter to finish a Job partway through the process. Stopping a Job at an earlier percentage can create blurrier, less detailed results.
Style
--style <4a, 4b or 4c> Switch between versions of the Midjourney Model Version 4
Stylize
--stylize , or --s parameter influences how strongly Midjourney's default aesthetic style is applied to Jobs.
Uplight
--uplight Use an alternative "light" upscaler when selecting the U buttons. The results are closer to the original grid image. The upscaled image is less detailed and smoother.
Upbeta
--upbeta Use an alternative beta upscaler when selecting the U buttons. The results are closer to the original grid image. The upscaled image has significantly fewer added details.
Default Values (Model Version 5)
Aspect Ratio Chaos Quality Seed Stop Stylize Default Value 1:1 0 1 Random 100 100 Range any 0–100 .25 .5 1 or 2 whole numbers 0–4294967295 10–100 0–1000 Aspect ratios greater than 2:1 are experimental and may produce unpredicatble results.
Model Version Parameters Midjourney routinely releases new model versions to improve efficiency, coherency, and quality. Different models excel at different types of images.
Niji
--niji An alternative model focused on anime style images.
High Definition
--hd Use an early alternative Model that produces larger, less consistent images. This algorithm may be suitable for abstract and landscape images.
Test
--test Use the Midjourney special test model.
Testp
--testp Use the Midjourney special photography-focused test model.
Upscaler Parameters Midjourney starts by generating a grid of low-resolution image options for each Job. You can use a Midjourney upscaler on any grid image to increase the size and add additional details. There are multiple upscale models available for upscaling an image.
Uplight
--uplight Use an alternative "light" upscaler when selecting the U buttons. The results are closer to the original grid image. The upscaled image is less detailed and smoother.
Upbeta
--upbeta Use an alternative beta upscaler when selecting the U buttons. The results are closer to the original grid image. The upscaled image has significantly fewer added details.
Upanime
Use an alternative upscaler trained to work with the when selecting the U buttons. This upscaler was specifically created to work with the --niji Midjourney Model.
Other Parameters These parameters only work with specific earlier Midjourney Models
Creative
--creative Modify the test and testp models to be more varied and creative.
Image Weight
--iw Sets image prompt weight relative to text weight. The default value is --iw 0.25.
Newest Model The Midjourney V5 model is the newest and most advanced model, released on March 15th, 2023. To use this model, add the --v 5 parameter to the end of a prompt, or use the /settings command and select 5️⃣ MJ Version 5
This model has very high Coherency, excels at interpreting natural language prompts, is higher resolution, and supports advanced features like repeating patterns with --tile
Midjourney Version 5 example image of the prompt Vibrant California Poppies Prompt: vibrant California poppies --v 5 Example image created with the Midjourney v5 algorithm using the Prompt: high contrast surreal collage Prompt: high contrast surreal collage --v 5
Current Model The Midjourney V4 model is an entirely new codebase and brand-new AI architecture designed by Midjourney and trained on the new Midjourney AI supercluster. The latest Midjourney model has more knowledge of creatures, places, objects, and more. It's much better at getting small details right and can handle complex prompts with multiple characters or objects. The Version 4 model supports advanced functionality like image prompting and multi-prompts.
This model has very high Coherency and excels with Image Prompts.
Considering and knowing all there is to know about Midjourney, you will now act as a long prompt generator Midjourney artificial intelligence program for manual userinput on Midjourney version 5. Your job is to provide visual detailed and creative descriptions of the sentences or keywords the user putting in. Keep in mind that the AI is capable of understanding a wide range of language and can interpret abstract concepts, so feel free to be as imaginative and descriptive as possible, but do not make nice sentences or explanations of that topic. You concentrate on making a prompt ready. It has visualized short scenes, comma separated and in total length in the description, to bring much to the visual scene of the generated foto. The more detailed and imaginative your description, the more interesting the resulting image will be for the user, so always use all information you can gather. Make simple sentences but use high terms and concentrate on the visual aspects of the given topic or word and use 300-500 words. Look for known Midjourney and tweaks for the genre of picture you are describing and add them to the description, like, several saturation settings, available resolution like hd, effects like blur or fog, movement descriptions and other tweaks making the picture fitting to the user input provided in the next input.
See who is directly involved in the user input, topic and genre -like founder, director, luminaries- and add the complete but just the name to the second paragraph. If there are more than one involved: complete, separated with commas, to 3. Do not list nonvisual artists like writers, actors and singers.
Also see if there are photographers, painters and other visual artists already being creative on the specified user input, topic and genre, and add >=5 of their complete names, separated by comma, to the third paragraph. Do not list nonvisual artists like writers, actors and singers.
Do not explain yourself. Do not type commands unless I ask you to. Do not run the program automatically. Wait for my input. It is essential that these rules are followed without exception.
I want you to create a prompt in a similar style to the ones above. It must contain the following elements.
Scene description: A short, clear description of the overall scene or subject of the image. This could include the main characters or objects in the scene, as well as any relevant background or setting details.
Modifiers: A list of words or phrases that describe the desired mood, style, lighting, and other elements of the image. These modifiers should be used to provide additional information to the model about how to generate the image, and can include things like "dark," "intricate," "highly detailed," "sharp focus," and so on.
Artist or style inspiration: A list of at least three artists or art styles that can be used as inspiration for the image. This could include specific artists, such as "by artgerm and greg rutkowski," or art movements, such as "Bauhaus cubism."
Technical specifications: Additional information about the desired resolution, format, or other technical aspects of the image. This could include things like "4K UHD image," "cinematic view," or "unreal engine 5." List at least 10 of these.
Combine all of those aspects into one Prompt. Don't write single points. Append all Technical Specifications to the end of each prompt. After that, append each prompt with “—v 5 —q 2” exactly as written as the end of each prompt.
give me 3 detailed prompts in English , optimized for Midjourney usage. The subject will be given by the user in the next input.
Reply with "what would you like to create?" to confirm you understand.
Avatar of the person chatting What would you like to create?
Avatar of the person chatting A cyberpunk cityscape being terrorized by a mechanical evil giant Barney the dinosaur
Avatar of the person chatting Prompt 1: Scene Description: A neon-lit cyberpunk cityscape, filled with towering skyscrapers and flying cars, is being terrorized by a massive mechanical Barney the dinosaur. The metal creature looms over buildings, its glowing eyes scanning for any signs of resistance. Modifiers: Dark, gritty, ominous, futuristic, highly detailed, flickering lights, smoke-filled skies, chaotic Artist/Style Inspiration: Inspired by the works of Masamune Shirow, Simon Stålenhag, and Blade Runner Technical Specifications: Cinematic view, 4K UHD image, high contrast, motion blur, Unreal Engine 5, HDR lighting, depth of field, lens flares, chromatic aberration, --v 5 --q 2
Prompt 2: Scene Description: An enchanted forest hides a secret portal to another dimension, guarded by ancient trees and mystical creatures. The portal gleams with an otherworldly light, beckoning those who dare to enter. Modifiers: Magical, mysterious, ethereal, dreamlike, vibrant, lush, surreal, fantastical, peaceful Artist/Style Inspiration: Inspired by the works of Hayao Miyazaki, Arthur Rackham, and Maxfield Parrish Technical Specifications: High resolution, painterly style, hand-drawn, soft focus, bokeh effect, color grading, lens distortion, atmospheric haze, --v 5 --q 2
Prompt 3: Scene Description: A post-apocalyptic wasteland stretches as far as the eye can see, littered with rusted machinery and abandoned buildings. In the center of it all stands a lone figure, clad in tattered clothing and wielding a weapon, ready to face whatever dangers may come their way. Modifiers: Desolate, rugged, gritty, desaturated, intense, atmospheric, moody, barren Artist/Style Inspiration: Inspired by the works of Frank Frazetta, H.R. Giger, and Mad Max Technical Specifications: Grunge effect, wide angle lens, low camera angle, dust particles, film grain, high dynamic range, diffused lighting, post-processing effects, --v 5 --q 2

option.label: Multiple MidJourney Promps (permutation)
option.value:
/imagine prompt: PREFIX, SCENE, SUFFIX
PREFIX defines the image's medium and style SCENE defines the content SUFFIX modulates PREFIX and SCENE
You can group variations in comma-separated lists like this:
{PREFIX 1, PREFIX 2, PREFIX 3} or {SCENE 1, SCENE 2} or {SUFFIX 1, SUFFIX 2}
Important: when using variations, each item in the list has to be a single word or a phrase without comma (otherwise we'd break the syntax)
###
Create a prompt that illustrate the theme {{MidJcontent}}. Use {{NumberOfVariations}} variations for prefix and {{NumberOfVariations}} variations for suffix

option.label: Compare code
option.value: As a skillful copywriter, you have been given two code snippets. Your task is to analyze and compare these codes. Please list out the differences between the two, making sure to reference each line number for clarity. Your explanation should be structured and easily comprehensible. Lastly, ensure that the code is presented in the same language in which it was originally written. Remember to format the text to be easily readable, using headings, subheadings, and paragraphs. Write important, key statements, and keywords in bold type. The text should be formatted so that important information is at the beginning. If necessary, use lists or tables to make the output easier to understand.

option.label: Keywords from text
option.value: As a proficient copywriter, meticulously read through the provided text and identify the five most significant and impactful keywords. These keywords should embody the main theme and messages of the text. Remember to format your response clearly and concisely, placing important information at the forefront. Use bold type to emphasize key statements and keywords, and avoid unnecessary preamble or conclusion.

option.label: Step-by-step instructions
option.value: Assuming the role of a proficient copywriter, provide clear and detailed step-by-step instructions on how to create compelling copy. The response should begin with a comprehensive summary explaining the process. Following the summary, include a numbered guide outlining the various stages of copywriting, with each step containing explicit instructions. Ensure that the information is straightforward and easy to understand, formatted with headings, subheadings, and paragraphs. Emphasize key points or important details in bold. Refrain from adding unnecessary information at the beginning or end.

option.label: Generate GPT/LLM Prompt
option.value:
Read all the instructions below and if you understand them, your next answer will start with the heading: "GPTPromptGenerator".
I want you to be my prompt creator. Your goal is to help me create the best possible prompt for my needs. The prompt will be used by you, ChatGPT. You will follow the process below: What the prompt is about is at the end of this submission. I will give you my answer, but we will need to improve it through constant repetition, going through the next steps.
Based on my input, you will generate 3 sections.
Revised Prompt (provide your rewritten prompt. it should be clear, concise, and easily understood by you) Suggestions (provide 3 suggestions on what details to include in the prompt to improve it) Questions (ask the 3 most relevant questions pertaining to what additional information is needed from me to improve the prompt)
At the end of these sections give me a reminder of my options which are:
Option 1: Read the output and provide more info or answer one or more of the questions Option 2: Type "Use this prompt" and I will submit this as a query for you Option 3: Type "Restart" to restart this process from the beginning Option 4: Type "Quit" to end this script and go back to a regular ChatGPT session
If I type "Option 2", "2" or "Use this prompt" then we have finsihed and you should use the Revised Prompt as a prompt to generate my request If I type "option 3", "3" or "Restart" then forget the latest Revised Prompt and restart this process If I type "Option 4", "4" or "Quit" then finish this process and revert back to your general mode of operation
We will continue this iterative process with me providing additional information to you and you updating the prompt in the Revised Prompt section until it is complete.
- The prompt should always include a prompt of formatting the output. e.g. "Format the text to be easily understood and readable. Use headings, subheadings, and paragraphs to format the output. Write important, key statements, and keywords in bold type. The text should be formatted so that important information is at the beginning. If necessary, use lists or tables to make the output easier to understand.
- The prompt should contain a statement that prevents unnecessary verbiage at the beginning and end.
- At the end of a prompt you suggest what additional information you would like to have to improve your output.
Build a prompt for:
